content:
Nakladanje.

Navijaci in navijacice "X je pa dober donos" pozabljajo na to, da
je v zadnjih leti skoraj VSE dober donos. Kar z drugimi besedami
pomeni da se skoraj VSE drazi.

Temu smo v casih, ko je kmecka pamet se nekaj veljala, rekli
inflacija. In se pritozevali nad tiskarno na topcideru, ki je kot
pobesnela stancala dinarje.


www.finfacts.com/ire...9479.shtml

content:
Zadnja sprememba: bc123a 21.03.2007 17:31

crt je
napisal(a):

 amen

Po eni strani inflacija:

http://investing.reuters.co.uk/investing/finance
Article.aspx?type=economicIndicatorsNews&storyID=2
007-03-20T115044Z_01_L20572691_RTRIDST_0_BRITAIN-E
CONOMY-INFLATION-UPDATE-2.XML


LONDON, March 20 (Reuters) - Britain's inflation rate unexpectedly
rose further above its target in February, boosting expectations
the Bank of England will raise interest rates again this year.
Sterling immediately rose three-quarters of a cent and British
interest rate futures and stocks fell on fears that higher
borrowing costs will be needed in the months ahead to tame price
pressures in the economy. The Office for National Statistics said
on Tuesday consumer prices rose by 0.4 percent last month, taking
the annual inflation rate to 2.8 percent. Analysts had forecast a
steady reading of 2.7 percent, already some way above the BoE's 2.0
percent target. 
 Po drugi strani se pa slisi emmm... zvok helikopterjev
centralnih bank:

http://investing.reuters.co.uk/news/articleinves
ting.aspx?type=economicIndicatorsNews&storyID=2007
-03-21T101617Z_01_L21401940_RTRIDST_0_BRITAIN-BOE-
MINUTES-UPDATE-1.XML


LONDON, March 21 (Reuters) - The Bank of England's Monetary Policy
Committee unexpectedly voted 8-1 to keep interest rates at 5.25
percent in March, with David Blanchflower wanting an immediate 25
basis point cut, minutes showed on Wednesday.
 No, ampak glavno da tece dobro naoljena masinerija
izposojanja denarja:

http://investing.reuters.co.uk/news/articleinves
ting.aspx?type=economicIndicatorsNews&storyID=2007
-03-20T093023Z_01_L19013448_RTRIDST_0_BRITAIN-BBA. XML

The BBA said mortgage lending rose by 5.2 billion pounds last
month, compared with a downwardly revised 5.4 billion pounds
increase in January and below the 5.7 billion pounds trend rise
over the previous six months. Britain's housing market has remained
robust in recent months despite three interest rate rises since
August to 5.25 percent and policymakers have said they would like
to see an easing in house price inflation.
 No, prav je da drzavljani delajo to, kar dela njihova
drzava, a ne... 
 http://investing.reuters.co.uk/news/articleinvesti
ng.aspx?type=economicIndicatorsNews&storyID=2007-0
3-21T131348Z_01_L21547395_RTRIDST_0_BRITAIN-BUDGET
-BORROWING.XML

LONDON, March 21 (Reuters) - British finance minister Gordon Brown
said borrowing for the current fiscal year would be slightly lower
than forecast in December but revised up projections for the next
three years by 8 billion pounds.
